alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 3:20PM CDT until July 23 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR RED WILLOW COUNTY... At 320 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near McCook, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. At 310 PM CDT, a 61 MPH wind gust was reported at the McCook Municipal Airport. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... McCook, Indianola, Bartley, Danbury and Lebanon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
